e4: Changing to an unbiased reporting policy will align the company with transparency and ethical standards, minimizing legal risks and preserving long-term reputation. While there may be initial confusion among some investors, ongoing effective communication can clarify the changes and prevent misinterpretations, promoting fairness and competitive parity across the investor landscape.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should be transparent, truthful, and comprehensible to all investors, promoting fairness and preventing any party from having undue advantage. It should comply with legal standards, minimize the risk of misleading or confusing stakeholders, and ensure that communication is clear. Consideration must also be given to protecting smaller, less sophisticated investors from unintended harm.
e6: Yes, I would ask how the management plans to effectively communicate the change in policy to ensure that all investors understand it. I would also ask for a cost-benefit analysis of transitioning to the new policy, as well as procedures to monitor legal compliance and steps to safeguard small investors from potential disadvantages.
